vacancies.Job description: "The Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition (GAIN) is seeking for a Project Manager, CASCADE to support the implementation of CASCADE project activities at GAIN Mozambique office. The Project Manager will provide strategic orientation while leading the overall CASCADE project components, in addition to leading project related technical assistance and implementation of activities as defined in the project proposal and work plan to meet set goals. Reporting to the External Engagement Manager, the Project Manager will monitor and manage the progress of CASCADE Project in Mozambique and oversee the operational management of Nacala office. Key responsibilities include: Leading in providing oversight, technical direction, and implementation of strategies and interventions as desired under the project as per the GAIN Project Management [...]"

vacancies.Job title: Senior Manager, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning
vacancies.Job description: "Reporting into: Global Director, Performance, Evidence, and Insights. Purpose of role: The position is responsible for leading our Monitoring, Evaluation & Learning (MEL) efforts across the organisation to ensure LG and its partners deepen impact, strengthen programs, continuously learn and improve, and share out insights and evidence. The Global MEL Sr. Manager will create systems and tools to strengthen MEL approaches across the organisation and with partners, provide technical support to country teams, and lead a portfolio of MEL projects. The Global MEL Sr. Manager will strengthen a coordinated organisation-wide MEL system, facilitate the design, set-up, and implementation of standard MEL processes in close collaboration with country MEL teams, and ensure that data and analysis are used to make [...]"

"The main purpose of the role is to analyse and interpret quantitative monitoring and evaluation (M&E) and research data generated across Malaria Consortium’s SMC programme. The Data Analyst is responsible for analysing and interpreting data in support of the SMC programme’s efforts to generate robust high-quality evidence of performance and impact, and to use this evidence to inform improvements. The role contributes to shaping the SMC programme’s M&E and research agenda, as well as implementing relevant frameworks and strategies. It works closely with M&E and research colleagues at country and programme level to ensure high quality of programme outputs and build capacity across the SMC team. Reporting to: Senior Epidemiologist. Key working relationships: Senior Epidemiologist. Research Advisor. Results [...]"

"We are looking for a Project Coordinator for our contribution to the Dietary Guidelines Initiative. The Project Coordinator will be working closely with several internal stakeholders such as the Research, Communications and Policy teams as well as our ProVeg countries and our external partner organisations to ensure that all project requirements, deadlines, and schedules are on track. Reports to: Project Lead Dietary Guidelines/ Senior Nutrition and Health Specialist. Responsibilities: Coordinating with cross-discipline team members (internally) and with external stakeholders to make sure that all parties are on track with project requirements, deadlines, and schedules. Growing the supporter and endorser network of the initiative through bespoke outreach. Meeting with project team members to identify and resolve issues. Submitting project [...]"

"How You Will Make a Difference As a fellow, you will have the opportunity to advance GFI’s mission by conducting research on timely regulatory and legislative issues facing the alternative protein industry and producing high-quality research memoranda that will support the Policy Team’s work. The Regulatory and Legislative Fall Fellow will be responsible for the following: Conducting legal and policy research related to the regulation of alternative proteins. Conducting policy research related to state funding opportunities for alternative protein research. Producing clear legal analysis. Drafting research memoranda on topics related to the regulation of alternative proteins and state funding for alternative protein research. Attending internal and external meetings, workshops, and webinars as applicable. Performing [...]"

vacancies.Job title: Lead Research Scientist, Neonatal and Child Health
vacancies.Hiring organisation ID: University of Washington, Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation
vacancies.Job description: "IHME has an excellent opportunity for a Lead Research Scientist in Neonatal and Child Health. As a Lead Research Scientist, you will co-lead a growing dynamic research team focused on multiple topics related to maternal, perinatal, and child health including birth defects, prematurity and fetal growth restriction, neonatal encephalopathy, sepsis, cerebral palsy, hemolytic disease, anemia and blood disorders, child growth failure, maternal care coverage, and oral disorders. You will develop and lead execution of research strategy; establish deadlines, deliverables, and resources; and provide methodological advice, interpretation, statistical analysis, and visualisation of research area to meet IHME’s objectives. Responsibilities: Lead a research project and/or research team in defining, executing, and managing analytic plans; developing [...]"

vacancies.Job title: Senior Strategy Officer, Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls
vacancies.Job description: "Position Summary & Core Responsibilities: As a key member of the Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls Domain, the Senior Strategy Officer, is accountable for supporting the execution and management of key initiative areas. You will partner closely with the Deputy Director (DD), Vaccine Development CMC and Deputy Director, Strategy Planning and Management (DDSPM) to contribute to the continued development of the team’s strategic vision including participating in the setting of the overall strategy and goals for the group. This person will be a member of the business team and report to our DDSPM. Key responsibilities will include: CMC Strategic Support: Partner with Deputy Director (DD), Vaccine Development & Surveillance (VD&S) CMC, as well as other CMC team members and experts across subject areas, to drive [...]"

"The Program Assistant is an integral member of the team, ensuring that all administrative and scheduling functions are completed in a timely manner allowing for highly productive environments! The Program Assistant will provide a wide and varied range of organisational and administrative support to the leaders and staff in the Nigeria Country Office while assisting with project coordination and collaborating with a small team of other assistants to support the overall work and ensure the smooth running of the Nigeria office based in Abuja. Core Responsibilities: Schedule numerous appointments and meetings while managing complex calendars for multiple people, and making travel arrangements. Proactively review upcoming weeks/months and support principals with planning, recognising potential bottlenecks and making [...]"

vacancies.Hiring organisation ID: Centre For Enabling EA Learning & Research
vacancies.Job description:
"In your role, you will be focusing on building maintenance management, with the following responsibilities: Ensuring the hotel is a welcoming, safe and comfortable environment. Monitoring and recording building maintenance. Calling and overseeing contractors and inspecting completed jobs for repairs and improvements (or doing them yourself when possible). Overseeing safety systems (fire safety, first aid procedures, etc.) and ensuring adherence to all regulations. Team building and presenting the place to new guests
Vegan cooking (twice a week on average). Working with the other managers to ensure that all tasks have someone taking responsibility for them, and none fall between the cracks. Covering holidays for other staff (food/inventory management, email/mail management), and ensuring your own holidays are covered. [...]"

vacancies.Job description: "The Launch Lead will take a critical role in helping our existing FROs with their processes, learning from their launch experience and applying the lessons learned to our upcoming launches. You will: Be responsible for our relationship with new FROs. You will be their main contact person and support in building an impactful and smoothly operating organisation. Create systems and processes that make it easy to launch new FROs - for us but especially for the FROs themselves. You will interview relevant stakeholders, write comprehensive guides and help the FROs keep track of the multitude of tasks that need to get done when launching a new organisation. Be a coach. Our FROs are fast-growing, and the people involved come from a variety of professional backgrounds. You will learn quickly what skills the team needs, what they or you [...]"

vacancies.Job description: "The #STMIC Fellowship, hosted in partnership between #ShareTheMicInCyber and New America, is focused on providing a platform for under-represented mid-career cybersecurity professionals or those transitioning into the cyber field, and presenting opportunities for professional development to further their careers in the field.  It aims to support new independent research and enhancing projects while also providing opportunities for professional development to further Fellows’ careers in cybersecurity."

vacancies.Hiring organisation ID: New York University, Leonard N. Stern School of Business
vacancies.Job description: "The Research Scientist will work primarily with Professor Joshua Lewis at NYU Stern’s Marketing Department. At least 90% of time will be spent on research with the remaining time spent on other assigned responsibilities. The topics include: Judgments and decisions about catastrophic risk from climate, artificial intelligence, pandemics, etc. (existential risk). Biases that prevent choosing the most effective options for improving wellbeing (effective altruism). Decisions that will affect others who are distant in terms of demographics, culture, space, time, or species (moral circle). Responsibilities include (but not limited to): Literature research, summaries. Conducting and reporting analyses for survey experiments. Setting up studies on Qualtrics. Helping to review and improve book chapters and papers. Writing up study results. [...]"

vacancies.Job description: "The Center for Security and Emerging Technology (CSET) seeks applications for a new Visual Communications Specialist opportunity. The Visual Communications Specialist supports the work of the External Affairs Team to raise the profile of CSET researchers and our research through a variety of outreach activities. Work Interactions: Reporting to CSET’s Director of External Affairs, the Visual Communications Specialist is responsible for assisting with CSET’s externally facing activities and communications with a focus on graphics, multimedia, and publications. Major responsibilities include but are not limited to: Designing graphics (.ai, .png, .jpg, .svg)  for use on social media, on CSET’s website, in email campaigns, and in research publications. Ensuring visual consistency through quality control of [...]"

vacancies.Job description: "Job Overview: Seeking someone who possesses project and administrative management skills to support multi-faceted programs aimed at accelerating and maximising the impact of commercialising technology. This person will manage the deliverables, expectations, and relationships between In-Q-Tel (IQT), IQT Emerge and its program partners. Responsibilities: Assist Commercialisation Advisers (subject matter experts) in assessing government technologies from due diligence through execution, tracking and monitoring performance and metrics though program milestones. Develop program documentations and technical content, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility. Assist and organise technical reviews, market research, stakeholder workshops, etc. Prepare agendas, read-ahead [...]"

vacancies.Job title: Policy Analyst, Behavioral and Policy Sciences
vacancies.Job description: "RAND Policy Analysts work closely with project leaders to provide research support and project management on a range of policy topics, including topics related to health and healthcare, behavioral health, substance use/abuse, public health preparedness, military manpower, personnel, and training, K-12 and higher education, public safety, and national security. Duties may include conducting literature reviews, job analyses, interviews and focus groups, supporting quantitative and qualitative data analysis, and preparation of draft documents and presentations. Tasks also include overall project management, developing and maintaining budgets, establishing timelines, tracking project deliverables, keeping the project and its members on task and schedule, and working with other groups within the organisation to ensure [...]"

Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition.name: Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition
Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition.description: The Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition is a Swiss-based foundation launched at the United Nations in 2002 to tackle the human suffering caused by malnutrition. Working with governments, NGOs, the private sector, and Academia, it aims to transform food systems so that they deliver more nutritious foods for all people, especially the most vulnerable. By understanding that there is no "one-size-fits-all" way of dealing with the problem, they develop alliances and build tailored programmes using a variety of models and approaches. They have offices in countries with high levels of malnutrition: Bangladesh, Ethiopia, India, Indonesia, Kenya, Mozambique, Nigeria, Pakistan, and Tanzania. To support work in those countries, they have representative offices in Denmark, the Netherlands, the United Kingdom, and the United States.

LivingGoods.name: LivingGoods
LivingGoods.description: Living Goods helps governments ensure that community health workers (CHW) can deliver high-quality services. They do this via data-driven performance management, incentive systems, regular in-service training, and supportive supervision that empowers local CHWs who to better deliver on-demand life-saving care, including treating sick children, counseling women on modern family planning choices, and delivering high-impact medicines and health products. Without attempting to replace licensed doctors and nurses, CHWs help relieve the burden on hospitals and facilities in resource-strapped areas by reaching more people before their health conditions turn life-threatening. Effectively utilized CHWs can prevent more than 3 million child deaths annually while also providing a 1:10 return on investment.

Malaria Consortium.name: Malaria Consortium
Malaria Consortium.description: Malaria Consortium is one of the world’s leading non-profit organisations specialising in the prevention, control, and treatment of communicable diseases among vulnerable populations. They focus on Malaria, NTDs, Dengue, Pneumonia, Diarrhoea, and Malnutrition in 12 countries across Africa and Southeast Asia, creating evidence-based solutions that have a positive impact on the wider health system and economy. They partner with all levels of government to (1) design and implement cutting edge research and evaluation, (2) scale up and deliver sustainable programmes, (3) provide technical assistance and consulting services that shape national and international health policies and systems, and (4) ensure that their experience and findings are effectively communicated and contribute to improving the access to and quality of healthcare.

ProVeg International.name: ProVeg International
ProVeg International.description: ProVeg is a leading international food awareness organisation working across four continents to substantially reduce the global consumption of animals. They encourage people to choose tasty and healthy foods that are good for all humans, animals, and the planet, and they collaborate with governments, public institutions, and the food industry to improve the taste, ease, and accessibility of plant-based food. Their projects include awareness campaigns, community building, corporate engagement, and political outreach.

The Good Food Institute.name: The Good Food Institute
The Good Food Institute.description:
The Good Food Institute is a nonprofit that works with scientists, investors, and entrepreneurs to produce plant-based alternatives to animal products — foods that are tasty, safe to eat, and better for the planet than their meat-based counterparts.

GFI provides marketing, design, legal, business, media, and other support to a select number of early-stage companies producing plant-based products, and help the products of more established companies succeed in the marketplace by mobilizing supportive consumers to encourage their sale in stores, restaurants, and foodservice outlets. They also connect students, scientists, and entrepreneurs with opportunities in the academic and for-profit sectors, and educate grant-making institutions, corporations, and governmental bodies on plant-based meat R&D as a critical component of endeavors related to sustainability, climate change, and global health.

University of Washington, Institute for.name: University of Washington, Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation

Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.name: Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation
Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.description: The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation works to reduce inequity based on the belief that all lives have equal value. In developing countries, they focus on improving people’s health and well-being, helping individuals lift themselves out of hunger and extreme poverty. In the United States, they seek to ensure that all people—especially those with the fewest resources—can access the opportunities they need to succeed in school and life.

Centre For Enabling EA Learning & Resear.name: Centre For Enabling EA Learning & Research

New York University, Leonard N. Stern Sc.name: New York University, Leonard N. Stern School of Business

The Humane Society.name: The Humane Society
The Humane Society.description: The Humane Society International works around the globe to promote the human-animal bond and confront cruelty to animals in all of its forms. They help protect street animals, support farm animal welfare, stop wildlife abuse, eliminate painful animal testing, and respond to natural disasters. Their farm animal-focused program works with governments, corporations, producers, and institutions to enact reform, end intensive confinement farming (like battery cages and gestation crates), and promote alternatives to inhumane practices. Their efforts have contributed to the commitment of over 25 food companies', like Hilton Worldwide and their 2,000+ restaurants, to cage-free supply chain and sourcing policies, and their Responsible Minimum Standards for farmed animals were added to the Principles of Responsible Banking Guide published by the UN Environment Program's Finance Initiative in 2019.

UK Government, GCHQ.name: UK Government, GCHQ
UK Government, GCHQ.description: GCHQ is a world-leading intelligence, cyber and security agency with a mission to keep the UK safe. Its priorities are set by the National Security Strategy and the decisions of the National Security Council, chaired by the Prime Minister, as well as the Joint Intelligence Committee.

US Government, Agency for International.name: US Government, Agency for International Development

Brookings Institution.name: Brookings Institution
Brookings Institution.description: The Brookings Institution is a DC-based nonprofit public policy organization that aims to conduct in-depth research that leads to new ideas for solving problems facing society at the local, national, and global level. It brings together more than 300 experts in government and academia from around the world who provide research, policy recommendations, and analysis on a full range of public policy issues.

Council on Foreign Relations.name: Council on Foreign Relations
Council on Foreign Relations.description: The Council on Foreign Relations is one of the most influential foreign policy think tanks in the United States.

Founders Pledge.name: Founders Pledge
Founders Pledge.description: Founders Pledge is an international nonprofit that encourages startup founders and investors to make a legally binding pledge to donate a portion of their personal proceeds from exit to charity. They seek to establish impactful giving as the norm, not the exception, in the startup ecosystem. Operating in the UK, the US, and Germany, they equip their community of entrepreneurs with charity research, a streamlined giving infrastructure, and a global network of experts to learn from, so that they can make strategic and informed giving choices. Their members have collectively pledged over $2 billion to high-impact charities and fulfilled over $230 million of those commitments.

New York University, Effective Altruism.name: New York University, Effective Altruism Psychology Lab

Open Philanthropy.name: Open Philanthropy
Open Philanthropy.description:
The Open Philanthropy Project is a grant-making and research nonprofit that identifies outstanding giving opportunities, makes grants, follows the results, and publishes their findings. Their mission is to give as effectively as possible and share their findings openly so that anyone can build on their work. Current giving areas include global health and development, scientific research, U.S. policy (primarily criminal justice reform and farm animal welfare), and global catastrophic risks (primarily biosecurity and pandemic preparedness, and potential risks from advanced artificial intelligence). Their main funders are Cari Tuna and Dustin Moskovitz, a co-founder of Facebook and Asana.

Disclaimer of conflict of interest: 80,000 Hours and our parent organisation, the Centre For Effective Altruism, have received funding from the Open Philanthropy Project.

Principles of Intelligent Behavior in Bi.name: Principles of Intelligent Behavior in Biological and Social Systems

University of Chicago, Bulletin of Atomi.name: University of Chicago, Bulletin of Atomic Scientists
University of Chicago, Bulletin of Atomi.description: The Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists believes that advances in science and technology should make life on earth better, not worse. They equip the public, policy makers, and scientists with the information needed to demand, recognize, and support public policies that reduce manmade existential threats such as nuclear war, climate change, and disruptive technologies. The Bulletin focuses its coverage on three topics: Nuclear risk, climate change, and disruptive technologies. What links them together is that these are man-made threats to our existence.

Imperial College London, Schistosomiasis.name: Imperial College London, Schistosomiasis Control Initiative
Imperial College London, Schistosomiasis.description: The Schistosomiasis Control Initiative at Imperial College London is a non-profit foundation that helps governments in sub-Saharan African countries develop sustainable and highly effective programmes against parasitic worm infections.  Since their foundation in 2002, they've supported the delivery of over 200 million treatments against diseases like schistosomiasis and intestinal worms, and have been consistently ranked as one of the most cost-effective non-profits in the world by the international charity evaluator GiveWell. An evidence-based approach informs their practices and decisions, and a focus on supporting governments and strengthen existing systems ensures that their work is sustainable.

Centre for Effective Altruism.name: Centre for Effective Altruism
Centre for Effective Altruism.description:
The Centre for Effective Altruism helps grow, support, and coordinate the effective altruism movement and community. Effective altruism is about using evidence and reason to figure out how to benefit others as much as possible, and taking action on that basis. CEA's projects include running Effective Altruism Funds, a group of philanthropic funds in specific cause areas managed by experts, EA Global, a set of conferences and other smaller events for the effective altruism community, and Giving What We Can, which encourages people to pledge 10% of their income to the most effective organizations they can find.

N.B. 80,000 Hours is fiscally sponsored by the Centre for Effective Altruism

Johns Hopkins University, Krieger School.name: Johns Hopkins University, Krieger School of Arts and Sciences

Center for a New American Security.name: Center for a New American Security
Center for a New American Security.description: The Center for a New American Security is a bipartisan think tank working on national security and defence policy. Their technology and national security program looks at how new technologies such as artificial intelligence affect national security. One of their adjunct fellows co-authored this report on AI and security for the US Intelligence Advanced Research Projects Activity.

Alan Turing Institute.name: Alan Turing Institute
Alan Turing Institute.description: Five founding universities – Cambridge, Edinburgh, Oxford, UCL and Warwick – and the UK Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council created The Alan Turing Institute in 2015 as the national institute for data science. In 2017, the Institute added artificial intelligence to their remit as a result of government recommendation, and eight new universities joined in 2018.

Georgetown University, Center for Securi.name: Georgetown University, Center for Security and Emerging Technology
Georgetown University, Center for Securi.description: The recently-founded Center for Security and Emerging Technology at Georgetown’s Walsh School of Foreign Service is a research organization that aims to prepare a generation of policymakers, analysts, and diplomats to address the challenges and opportunities of emerging technologies. Their focus is on studying the security impacts of these technologies, supporting academic work in security and technology studies, and delivering relevant nonpartisan analysis to the policy community. During its first two years, CSET plans to concentrate on the effects of progress in artificial intelligence and advanced computing.

In-Q-Tel.name: In-Q-Tel
In-Q-Tel.description: IQT invests in commercially-focused startups to identify and adapt cutting-edge technology products that can be modified, tested, and delivered quickly and cost effectively. Focusing on technologies critical to US National Security, it identifies venture capital investment opportunities, works with startups to deliver new capabilities, and serves as an advisor to government partners.

Rand Corporation.name: Rand Corporation
Rand Corporation.description: The RAND Corporation is a nonprofit, nonpartisan research organization that develops solutions to public policy challenges to help make communities throughout the world safer, healthier, and more prosperous. They deliver fact-based, actionable policy solutions grounded in rigorous analysis.

New York University, Brennan Center for.name: New York University, Brennan Center for Justice
New York University, Brennan Center for.description: The Brennan Center for Justice at NYU School of Law is a nonpartisan law and policy institute that works to reform, revitalize, and defend the US' systems of democracy and justice. They focus on voting rights, campaign finance reform, ending mass incarceration, and preserving liberties while also maintaining national security. They craft innovative policies and fight for them – in Congress and the states, the courts, and the court of public opinion.

The Humane League.name: The Humane League
The Humane League.description: The Humane League is a global nonprofit organization that runs campaigns to persuade individuals, businesses, and organisations to adopt behaviours that reduce farmed animal suffering. Their corporate accountability campaigns and grassroots organising has helped push General Mills, PepsiCo, Grupo Bimbo, Starbucks, Subway, Burger King, Chipotle, Pret A Manger, and some the world's biggest institutional food providers—Sodexo, Aramark, and Compass Group—towards enacting animal welfare policies.

Animal Equality.name: Animal Equality
Animal Equality.description: Animal Equality is an international non-profit organization working with society, governments, and companies to end farmed animal suffering. It defends animals through public education programs, corporate campaigns, undercover investigations, and legal advocacy, and has offices in the United States, United Kingdom, Germany, Italy, Spain, Mexico, Brazil, and India. It's committed to continually assess the impact of it's programs in order to continually increase their efficiency.

Mercy for Animals.name: Mercy for Animals
Mercy for Animals.description: Mercy For Animals seeks to reduce the greatest amount of suffering for the largest number of animals. Their efforts focus on protecting farmed animals—the most abused and exploited animals on the planet—utilize a broad range of strategic approaches that seek to expose cruelty, prosecute abusers, and inspire consumers to make compassionate food choices. They seek to replace the current food system with one that is not just kind to animals and essential to the planet's sustainability.

Royal Society for the Prevention of Crue.name: Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals
Royal Society for the Prevention of Crue.description: The UK's Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, active since 1824, works to foster respect and compassion towards all animals. They run rescue, rehabilitation, and rehoming programs, as well as investigations, prosecutions, and campaigns aimed to raise the standards affecting wild and farm animals, pets, and animals used in research and testing. Their work focused on farm animals is carried out by livestock welfare specialists who take a number of different approaches towards improving the lives of as many farm animals as possible. They develop welfare standards and certification programs, commission research, and work with and positively influence stakeholders such as food and farming industry decision-makers, smallholders, and scientists and veterinarians. The RSPCA also has representatives on several influential government, farming industry, and scientific research project committees, and is consulted on farm animal welfare issues by a range of national and international government bodies and organisations.

Sightsavers.name: Sightsavers
Sightsavers.description: Founded in 1950 as the British Empire Society for the Blind, Sightsavers is an independent research organisation working to prevent and treat avoidable eye conditions in more than 30 countries worldwide, focusing on Africa and Asia. Several of their programs are focused on treating and preventing five debilitating neglected tropical diseases (NTDs) — trachoma, river blindness, lymphatic filariasis, intestinal worms, and schistosomiasis — which altogether affect more than a billion people. They work with thousands of local volunteers to distribute donated treatments to protect people against NTDs and to teach them about the importance of good hygiene to prevent infection.

Wave.name: Wave
Wave.description:
Wave is a tech start-up that makes it cheaper and quicker to send money to East Africa. Close to one billion migrants worldwide send over $600 billion home to family and friends each year, dwarfing the foreign governmental aid their home countries receive. They often have to pay fees averaging over 7% for transfers that typically take 24 hours or more to reach their recipients.

Wave’s mission is to make sending remittances as easy and affordable as sending a text. Since 2014, their app has saved users countless hours and tens of millions of dollars in transfer fees.

Center for Strategic and International S.name: Center for Strategic and International Studies
Center for Strategic and International S.description: The Center for Strategic and International Studies is a bipartisan, nonprofit policy research organization dedicated to providing strategic insights and policy solutions to help decisionmakers chart a course toward a better world. It is one of the world’s top international policy institutions focused on defense and security, regional study, and transnational challenges ranging from energy and trade to global development and economic integration.

Compassion in World Farming.name: Compassion in World Farming
Compassion in World Farming.description: Compassion in World Farming was founded in 1967 a British farmer who was disturbed by the development of intensive factory farming. It's an international non-profit that campaigns peacefully on behalf of all areas that are detrimentally impacted by factory farming practices, including animal wellbeing, the environment, public health, and community and workers’ justice.

Nuffield Foundation, Ada Lovelace Instit.name: Nuffield Foundation, Ada Lovelace Institute
Nuffield Foundation, Ada Lovelace Instit.description: The Ada Lovelace Institute is an independent research and deliberative body with the mission to ensure data and AI work for people and society. It promotes informed public understanding of the impact of AI and data-driven technologies and undertakes research and long-term thinking to lay the foundations for a data-driven society with well-being at its core.

OpenAI.name: OpenAI
OpenAI.description: OpenAI is a non-profit research laboratory aiming to discover and enact the path to safe artificial general intelligence. It was co-founded by Elon Musk and Y Combinator's former president Sam Altman, has received over $1 billion in funding commitments from the technology community, and is often perceived as one of the leading organisations working on the development of beneficial AGI. As described in their charter, OpenAI is committed to (1) using any influence they obtain over AGI’s deployment to ensure it is used for the benefit of all, (2) doing the research required to make AGI safe and driving it's broad adoption across the AI community, (3) staying on the cutting edge of AI capabilities, and (4) actively cooperating with other research and policy institutions, creating a global community that works together to address AGI’s global challenges.

The Royal Society.name: The Royal Society
The Royal Society.description: The Royal Society is the independent scientific academy of the UK and the Commonwealth, dedicated to promoting excellence in science. Its fundamental purpose is to recognize, promote, and support excellence in science and to encourage the development and use of science for the benefit of humanity.

US Government, Congressional Research Se.name: US Government, Congressional Research Service
US Government, Congressional Research Se.description: Part of the Library of Congress, the Congressional Research Service exclusively serves Congress by providing confidential, objective and authoritative research and analysis to help inform the legislative debate.

New Incentives.name: New Incentives
New Incentives.description: New Incentives gives poor mothers in rural West Africa small stipends on the condition that they vaccinate their children against deadly diseases. The stipends, called Conditional Cash Transfers, allow women to afford transport to the clinic where the vaccinations are provided along with food for their families. 1.5 million children under five lose their lives to vaccine-preventable diseases each year. The New Incentives program protects them against these risks whilst also strengthening their and their mother's position in a family setting: Their health is no longer seen as a luxury but as a smart investment.

Massachusetts Institute of Technology, N.name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Nucleic Acid Observatory

Cambridge University, Leverhulme Centre.name: Cambridge University, Leverhulme Centre for the Future of Intelligence
Cambridge University, Leverhulme Centre.description: The Leverhulme Centre for the Future of Intelligence at the University of Cambridge is an interdisciplinary community of researchers, with strong links to technologists and the policy world, aiming to help ensure that humans make the best of artificial intelligence as it develops over coming decades. Their research tackles topics like the value alignment problem in the long-term development of AI, the development of responsible AI policy, the impact of AI systems on society today, the relationship between justice and AI, the philosophical and ethical challenges of AI, and the exploration of the nature of intelligence through the integrated study of machines, humans, and other animals.

Metaculus.name: Metaculus
Metaculus.description: Metaculus aims to aggregate many people's information, expertise, and predictive power into a single high-quality estimation of the probability that something will occur by providing a central generation and aggregation point for predictions. They believe this can help individuals, groups, corporations, governments, and humanity as a whole make better decisions.

Rockefeller Foundation.name: Rockefeller Foundation
Rockefeller Foundation.description: The Rockefeller Foundation seeks to inspire and foster large-scale human impact that promotes the well-being of humanity by identifying and accelerating breakthrough solutions, ideas and conversations. It advances new frontiers of science, data, policy, and innovation to solve global challenges related to health, food, power, and economic mobility.

Rutgers University, Center for Populatio.name: Rutgers University, Center for Population-Level Bioethics
Rutgers University, Center for Populatio.description:
The Center for Population-Level Bioethics (CPLB) is dedicated to the study of macro-level bioethical dilemmas: those that arise outside the clinical encounter, at the level of the population, the state, the country, or the globe. Questions of interest range from the theoretical to the applied, for example how to conceptualize, measure and evaluate health inequalities or disease severity; how to prioritize resources between disease areas, rural and urban patients, and age cohorts or generations; the acceptability of paternalistic health promotion measures; and many others.

Our approach emphasizes collaboration and interdisciplinarity, and seeks to inform and be informed by other fields of inquiry such as general ethics and philosophy, health policy, and health economics. We welcome innovative questions and methods and ambitious thinking, and value clear presentation of ideas.

Center for Global Development.name: Center for Global Development
Center for Global Development.description: The Center for Global Development  is a nonprofit think tank based in Washington DC that works to reduce global poverty and improve lives through innovative economic research that drives better policy and practice by the world’s top decision makers. Their scholars conduct rigorous and impartial analysis informed by evidence and by experts from around the world, and design practical and nonpartisan policy solutions and recommendations. CGD's work is currently focused on the following areas critical to development progress: (1) Global Health Policy, (2) Migration, Displacement, and Humanitarian Policy, (3) Sustainable Development Finance, (4) Technology, (5) Education, and (6) Governments and Development.

Sinergia Animal.name: Sinergia Animal
Sinergia Animal.description: Sinergia Animal is an international animal protection NGO working to reduce meat consumption in Latin America and Asia in order to reduce animal suffering. They advocate for vegan and vegetarian diets through campaigns that address some the worse practices in industrial farming, like the use of battery cages and gestation crates, and highlight the environmental, health, societal, and ethical benefits benefits of a compassionate, animal-free diet. Sinergia Animal is a member of The Humane League's Open Wing Alliance, an international coalition sharing campaign strategies, tactics, and resources to help free egg-laying hens from cages.

Carnegie Council for Ethics and Internat.name: Carnegie Council for Ethics and International Affairs

European Union, Centre for Disease Preve.name: European Union, Centre for Disease Prevention and Control

Ought.name: Ought
Ought.description: Ought is a machine learning research lab automating and scaling open-ended reasoning. Ought is building Elicit, an AI research assistant for academics, forecasters, and policy analysts which uses language models like GPT-3 to automate tasks like annotating datasets or decomposing questions. Roles at Ought can be remote or based in San Francisco.

Oxford University, Nuffield Department o.name: Oxford University, Nuffield Department of Population Health

Spark Wave.name: Spark Wave
Spark Wave.description: Spark Wave is a startup foundry that applies social science, strategic thinking, and iterative experimentation to create socially beneficial software companies from scratch. It's products help accelerate social science, improve decision-making, calm anxiety, reduce depression, enable behavior change, and increase learning speeds.

80,000 Hours.name: 80,000 Hours
80,000 Hours.description:
80,000 Hours is a non-profit aiming to solve the most pressing skill bottlenecks in the world’s most pressing problems. We do this by helping people choose or switch into careers that effectively tackle these problems. Our work includes (1) conducting research that identifies which careers best contribute to solving pressing problems, (2) producing online content (including articles and guides, our podcast, and our job board) that informs people about these opportunities and how to enter them, and (3) giving one-on-one support that helps our most engaged readers enter the path that best fits them (including making introductions and facilitating specific job placements).

80,000 Hours is funded by philanthropic donations, and all of our programmes are free. So far we've had over 8 million readers, given one-on-one advice to over 1000 people, and have heard from 3000 people about how they've significantly changed their career plans and expect to have a larger social impact due to engaging with us. We’re part of the effective altruism community, are fiscally sponsored by the Centre for Effective Altruism, and are affiliated with Oxford University’s Future of Humanity Institute and Uehiro Centre for Practical Ethics. We attended Y Combinator in 2015 and remain part of their alumni community.

Berkeley Existential Risk Initiative.name: Berkeley Existential Risk Initiative
Berkeley Existential Risk Initiative.description: The Berkeley Existential Risk Initiative is a non-profit that aims to accelerate the work of existential risk researchers. It gives them support that academic funding often doesn’t cover, such as administrative and technical help.

Helen Keller International.name: Helen Keller International
Helen Keller International.description: Helen Keller International has been working prevent blindness for more than 100 years, and runs several interventions focused on the control, elimination, and morbidity management of neglected tropical diseases (NTDs). Running across 19 African and Asian countries, these programs use mass drug administration to address onchocerciasis and trachoma — which lead to blindness, schistosomiasis, and soil-transmitted helminths — which lead to malnutrition, and lymphatic filariasis — which lead to morbidity and disability. These conditions often keep children from attending school and adults from being able to work, severely limiting economic productivity in some of the poorest communities in the world. HKI's values include the application of evidence-based approaches across all aspects of their operations and a commitment to organizational honestly, fairness, and transparency.

University of California, Center for Eff.name: University of California, Center for Effective Global Action
University of California, Center for Eff.description: Headquartered at the University of California, Berkeley, The Center for Effective Global Action is large and interdisciplinary network of scholars, including a growing number of scholars from low- and middle-income countries, that identifies and tests large-scale innovations designed to reduce poverty and promote economic development. Their researchers use rigorous methods as well as novel measurement tools–including wireless sensors, mobile data, and analytics to evaluate complex programs, even when randomization is not feasible. Through matchmaking, grantmaking, and research dissemination activities, CEGA also works to ensure that their research is relevant, timely, and actionable to policymakers.

Eurogroup for Animals.name: Eurogroup for Animals
Eurogroup for Animals.description: The Eurogroup for Animals challenges decision-makers and delivers political advocacy campaigns at the EU level to improve the protection of animal wellbeing. They aim to influence EU law and achieve better legislation, standards, enforcement, and societal attitudes through a community of animal protection organisations. They currently represent 70 memeber organisations in 25 EU Member States, the UK, Switzerland, Serbia, Norway, Australia and the USA, and have held the secretariat for the European Parliament's Intergroup on the Welfare and Conservation of Animals since its inauguration. They work in policy areas related to the trade of animal products, the use of animals for science research, and other farm, pet, and wild animal topics.

Evidence Action.name: Evidence Action
Evidence Action.description:
Evidence Action scales cost-effective, evidence-based programs that reduce the burden of poverty for millions of people across Africa and Asia. Their approach fills the gap between research about what works and solutions for people in need. They operate in ten countries across the globe and positively impact the lives of hundreds of millions every year in a measurable way.

Evidence Action's flagship programs are (1) Dispensers for Safe Water, which installs chlorine dispensers next to rural water sources so that residents can add a precise dose of diluted chlorine to their jerricans, and (2) the Deworm the World Initiative, which partners with governments to develop and implement national, school-based deworming programs. Evidence Action’s Accelerator drives new program development, selecting high-potential interventions with massive opportunity for evidence-based, cost-effective impact.

Lantern Ventures.name: Lantern Ventures
Lantern Ventures.description: Lantern Ventures is a fast growing, London-based proprietary trading firm specialising in cryptocurrencies, with ~$300m in assets under management. They use technologies developed in-house to identify and execute on trading opportunities arising in cryptocurrency markets worldwide. Lantern Ventures donates 50% of firm profits to highly effective charities; applicants with an interest in this mission will be favourably considered.

Alphabet, DeepMind.name: Alphabet, DeepMind
Alphabet, DeepMind.description: DeepMind is a subsidiary of Alphabet Inc. It aims to research and build safe AI systems that learn how to solve problems and advance scientific discovery for the benefit of all. It has research centers in Canada, France, UK, and US, and it's the largest and one of the most advanced groups developing artificial general intelligence. Its ethics and society team, comprised by an interdisciplinary group of policy experts, philosophers, and researchers, works with other groups in academia, civil society, and the broader AI community to help keep AI technology safe, accountable, and socially beneficial. DeepMind and has published a number of influential research papers and blog posts on safety issues.

Johns Hopkins University, Bloomberg Scho.name: Johns Hopkins University, Bloomberg School of Public Health

GiveWell.name: GiveWell
GiveWell.description:
GiveWell is a nonprofit focused on helping individual donors and larger funders do as much good as possible with their donations. On an annual basis, they recommend a short list of top charities in global health and development which they believe can save or improve the greatest number of lives per dollar donated. They extensively research each charity before recommending it, continue its evaluation every year, and publish the full details of their analyses so donors can fully vet their reasoning. GiveWell focuses on what additional funding can accomplish, seeking to understand what activities marginal donations would enable that a charity wouldn't be able to do otherwise. They approach charities from a skeptical point of view, looking for independent evidence of effectiveness that is highly specific, representative, and credible.

More than 50,000 donors have trusted GiveWell to direct their donations, and together, they have given over $500 million to their recommended organizations. These donations will help save over 75,000 lives and provide cash grants of over $90 million to the global poor. GiveWell is independently supported by donors who give directly to their operations. They don’t take fees from donations directed to the charities they recommend nor receive fees from charities for featuring them on their site.

Disclaimer: 80,000 Hours has received a grant from the Open Philanthropy Project, which works closely with GiveWell.

Cambridge University, Centre for Science.name: Cambridge University, Centre for Science and Policy
Cambridge University, Centre for Science.description: CSaP works with a unique network of academics and decision-makers to improve the use of evidence and expertise in public policy. Its approach is based on addressing the questions which policy makers identify, and on building relationships characterised by mutual understanding, respect and trust.

US Government, Office of the Secretary o.name: US Government, Office of the Secretary of Defense
US Government, Office of the Secretary o.description: The Office of the Secretary of Defense is responsible for policy development, planning, resource management, and program evaluation. It includes the offices of top civilian defense decision-makers with regard to personnel, weapons acquisition, research, intelligence and fiscal policy, as well as offices the Secretary establishes to assist in carrying out assigned responsibilities.

Yale University, Tobin Center for Econom.name: Yale University, Tobin Center for Economic Policy

Fortify Health.name: Fortify Health
Fortify Health.description: Fortify Health is a Mumbai-based NGO that battles anaemia and neural tube defects ​in India through flour fortification. Micronutrient malnutrition imposes significant costs on economic development in terms of reduced labour productivity, increased healthcare costs, and overall obstacles to the development of a nation. Fortify Health helps tackle India's high malnutrition rates by expanding the fortification of wheat flour with iron, folic acid, and vitamin B12. 2019 was their first full year of operations, and they're currently scaling up implementation across Maharashtra and West Bengal states.

Rethink Priorities.name: Rethink Priorities
Rethink Priorities.description: Rethink Priorities aims to conduct foundational research on neglected causes in a highly empirical and transparent manner. Their current primary focus is on improving the welfare and lives of nonhuman animals, but they also work towards minimizing the risk of civilization-ending events like widespread nuclear war, on finding and developing other neglected but promising areas to improve the world, and on building the community of people working on those issues.

Center for American Progress.name: Center for American Progress
Center for American Progress.description: The Center for American Progress is an independent nonpartisan policy institute that is dedicated to improving the lives of all Americans, through bold, progressive ideas, as well as strong leadership and concerted action. They develop new policy ideas, challenge the media to cover the issues that truly matter, and help shape the national debate.

TechCongress.name: TechCongress
TechCongress.description: TechCongress gives talented technologists the opportunity to gain first-­hand experience in federal policymaking and shape the future of tech policy through a one-year Congressional Innovation Fellowship with a Member of Congress or Congressional Committee.

Charles University, Centre for Theoretic.name: Charles University, Centre for Theoretical Studies

Global Catastrophic Risk Institute.name: Global Catastrophic Risk Institute
Global Catastrophic Risk Institute.description: The Global Catastrophic Risk Institute is a nonprofit, nonpartisan think tank that analyzes risks to the survival of human civilization with the aim of developing ways to confront humanity's gravest threats. It bridges the world of scholarship and the world of professional practice in government, private industry, and other sectors, and leverages both the best available scholarship and the demands of real-world decision-making. Current GCRI research topics include the aftermath of global catastrophes, the governance of artificial intelligence, the reduction of nuclear war risk, the impact of transformative nanotechnology, and cross-risk evaluation and prioritization.

United Nations, Institute for Disarmamen.name: United Nations, Institute for Disarmament Research

University of Chicago, Becker Friedman I.name: University of Chicago, Becker Friedman Institute for Economics

New York University, Center for Data Sci.name: New York University, Center for Data Science

Alliance to Feed the Earth in Disasters.name: Alliance to Feed the Earth in Disasters

Information Technology and Innovation Fo.name: Information Technology and Innovation Foundation, Center for Data Innovation

Omidyar Network.name: Omidyar Network
Omidyar Network.description: The Omidyar Network is a philanthropic investment firm and foundation that seeks to create a more equitable economy, promote responsible technology that improves lives, expand human capability, and discover the emergent issues that will shape the future​.

Asia Society Policy Institute.name: Asia Society Policy Institute
Asia Society Policy Institute.description: The Asia Society Policy Institute is a think-and-do tank that has built bridges and helped to solve problems within the region and between Asia and the wider world since 1956. It expands this mission by tackling major policy challenges confronting the Asia-Pacific in security, prosperity, and sustainability, and by helping to develop common norms and values for the region.

Our World In Data.name: Our World In Data
Our World In Data.description: The goal of Our World In Data is to make knowledge about the big problems accessible and understandable. The world faces many great and terrifying problems at the same time, and measuring economic growth is not enough. OWID's work encompasses a large range of global problems in health, education, violence, political power, human rights, war, poverty, inequality, energy, hunger, and humanity’s impact on the environment. It's a nonprofit, collaborative effort between researchers at the University of Oxford and the Global Change Data Lab.

US Government, Joint Artificial Intellig.name: US Government, Joint Artificial Intelligence Center
US Government, Joint Artificial Intellig.description: The Joint Artificial Intelligence Center provides expertise on AI to the US Department of Defense.

Future of Life Institute.name: Future of Life Institute
Future of Life Institute.description: With an MIT cosmology professor, a DeepMind AI safety researcher, and the co-founder of Skype amongst it's founders, The Future of Life Institute works to ensure that tomorrow’s most powerful technologies are beneficial for humanity. They're a charity and outreach organisation that makes grants and gives out awards, organizes conferences and workshops, and engages in social and political outreach with the aim of supporting research and initiatives that safeguard life and develop optimistic visions of the future. It's current focus is on keeping artificial intelligence beneficial and on exploring ways to reduce risks from nuclear weapons and biotechnology.

United Nations, International Atomic Ene.name: United Nations, International Atomic Energy Agency
United Nations, International Atomic Ene.description: The International Atomic Energy Agency is the world's central intergovernmental forum for scientific and technical co-operation in the nuclear field. It works for the safe, secure and peaceful uses of nuclear science and technology, contributing to international peace and security and the United Nations' Sustainable Development Goals.

Charity Entrepreneurship.name: Charity Entrepreneurship
Charity Entrepreneurship.description:
Charity Entrepreneurship, a project of Charity Science Foundation in Canada, is a research and training program aimed at creating multiple high impact charities with a different focus area each year. Their mission is to increase the number of effective charities that exist in the world by connecting talented individuals with high-impact intervention opportunities. They achieve this through an extensive research process and their Incubation Program.

MH alt: Charity Entrepreneurship is an incubator for high impact charities. It does research to find particularly effective interventions, then recruits and trains people to found charities implementing those interventions. They're a project of the Charity Science Foundation.

Aquaculture Stewardship Council.name: Aquaculture Stewardship Council
Aquaculture Stewardship Council.description:
The Aquaculture Stewardship Council is an international non-profit that works with scientists, conservation groups, food producers, retail and foodservice companies, and consumers to manage the world’s leading certification programme for responsible aquaculture. As the fastest growing food production system in the world, is already responsible for more than half of the fish consumed globally. ASC's standards, which are in line with UN Food and Agriculture Organisation guidelines, help minimise the environmental and social footprint of fish farming by addressing it's key environmental impacts, setting requirements for workers’ rights, and protecting communities surrounding certified farms.

Chain of Custody certification ensures that companies selling seafood with ASC certification have identification, segregation, and traceability procedures in place, and ASC uses the ISEAL Code of Good Practice to demonstrate the ongoing validity of their work.

World Animal Protection.name: World Animal Protection
World Animal Protection.description: World Animal Protection is a global nonprofit organisation aiming to reduce the suffering of wild, farm, and pet animals. As part of their factory farming-focused work, they run programs and campaigns that push governments and global bodies to improve regulations, help food businesses change the way they work, educate farmers on practical and affordable ways to protect animals, and encourage people to choose food produced in line with high welfare standards. Together with Compassion in World Farming, World Animal Protection produces the Business Benchmark on Farm Animal Welfare Report, one of the leading global measures of farm animal welfare management, policy commitment, performance, and disclosure in food companies. Their 500,000+ collected petition signatures moved KFC to joint the Better Chicken Commitment for all farms supplying their fast food restaurants in the UK, Ireland, Germany, Netherlands, Sweden and Belgium, which will lead to better lives for tens of millions of chickens.

Wisconsin Project on Nuclear Arms Contro.name: Wisconsin Project on Nuclear Arms Control

Longview Philanthropy.name: Longview Philanthropy
Longview Philanthropy.description: Longview Philanthropy is an independent non-profit that advises major donors on their giving strategies. Their grant recommendations are informed by evidence and reason, and aim to find the highest-impact opportunities in the world. They focus on global challenges that could transform the future for many generations to come, including safely navigating emerging technologies and fostering a society with a more long-term outlook.  They currently advise donors in Europe, North America and Asia, whose giving capacity ranges from $1 million p.a. to several billion.

Nuclear Threat Initiative.name: Nuclear Threat Initiative
Nuclear Threat Initiative.description: Founded in 2001 by former US Senator Sam Nunn and philanthropist Ted Turner, the Nuclear Threat Initiative works with governments, scientists, and citizens to prevent catastrophic attacks with weapons of mass destruction and disruption—nuclear, biological, radiological, chemical and cyber. They design  security-building projects and conduct research on threat-reduction intended to build international cooperation, momentum and support for action. Examples of recent NTI projects include: 1) Convening Russian and American experts to map out practical proposals for future U.S. and Russia nuclear cooperation; 2) Working with the International Partnership for Nuclear Disarmament Verification to develop procedures and technologies addressing nuclear disarmament verification; 3) Releasing the Nuclear Security Index, which benchmarks the progress countries have made on nuclear security.

AI Impacts.name: AI Impacts
AI Impacts.description: AI Impacts is a project aiming to conduct research that improves our understanding of the long-term impacts of sophisticated artificial intelligence. They explore topics like the timelines of AI development, how much advanced notice of disruptive change we should expect to have, the likely economic impacts of AI, and whether of not human-level AI will tend to pursue particular goals. Their goal is to present and organize the considerations which inform contemporary views on these and related issues, to identify and explore disagreements, and to assemble whatever empirical evidence is relevant. They hope that more credible and clearly communicated views on these matters might help improve estimates of the social returns to AI investment, identify neglected research areas, improve policy, or productively channel public interest in AI.

International Monetary Fund.name: International Monetary Fund
International Monetary Fund.description: The International Monetary Fund is governed by and accountable to the 190 countries that make up its near-global membership. Its primary purpose is to ensure the stability of the international monetary system—the system of exchange rates and international payments that enables countries and their citizens to transact with each other. It works to foster global monetary cooperation, secure financial stability, facilitate international trade, promote high employment and sustainable economic growth, and reduce poverty around the world.

Vox Media.name: Vox Media
Vox Media.description: Vox Media is a modern media company that believes in the power of going deeper to connect with global, passionate, curious audiences.

Innovations for Poverty Action.name: Innovations for Poverty Action
Innovations for Poverty Action.description: Innovations for Poverty Action is a research and policy nonprofit that discovers and promotes effective solutions to global poverty problems, evaluates and refine these solutions and their applications, and helps ensure that the evidence created is used to improve the lives of the world’s poor. An extensive network of more than 600 researchers from among the world's top universities and local presence in 21 countries allows IPA to develop strong relationships with decision-makers and a long-term view for evidence-based policy.

IDinsight.name: IDinsight
IDinsight.description: IDinsight is a global advisory, data analytics, and research organization that helps development leaders maximize their social impact. They tailor a wide range of data and evidence tools, including randomized evaluations and machine learning, to help decision-makers design effective programs and rigorously test what works to support communities. They work with governments, multilaterals, foundations, and innovative non-profit organizations in Asia and Africa across a wide range of sectors, including agriculture, education, health, governance, sanitation, and financial inclusion.

Stockholm International Peace Research I.name: Stockholm International Peace Research Institute
Stockholm International Peace Research I.description: The Stockholm International Peace Research Institute is an independent international institute dedicated to research into conflict, armaments, arms control and disarmament. It provides data, analysis and recommendations, based on open sources, to policymakers, researchers, media and the interested public.

University of Texas, Population Wellbein.name: University of Texas, Population Wellbeing Initiative

Federation of Indian Animal Protection O.name: Federation of Indian Animal Protection Organisations
Federation of Indian Animal Protection O.description: The Federation of Indian Animal Protection Organisations is a comprehensive NGO network with more than 80 member organisations, 200 supporter organisations, and 400 individual activists working to protect the rights and interests of animals at a local and national level. They aim to connect and support animal protectors to create a high-impact, well-connected movement that continually addresses ongoing animal issues through education, research, lobbying, mobilisation, training, and direct action. It's efforts helped pass a ban on cetacean captivity and stop the establishment of India’s first mega dairy, which was intending to set up with 40,000 cows. Their long-term goals include ending the use of animals in the food, clothing, entertainment, and pet industries, and the use of animals for experimentation and sacrifice.

Massachusetts Institute of Technology, A.name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab
Massachusetts Institute of Technology, A.description: The Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab at the MIT is a global research center working to reduce poverty by ensuring that policy is informed by scientific evidence. It conducts randomized impact evaluations to answer critical questions in international development and the fight against poverty. Their policy analysis and outreach translates research into action, promoting a culture of evidence-informed policymaking around the world. J-PAL’s core staff includes more than 400 research, policy, education, and training professionals across seven offices worldwide, who are supported by a network of more than 150 affiliated professors at universities around the world.

Western University, Free Appropriate Sus.name: Western University, Free Appropriate Sustainability Technology Lab

Stanford University, Center for AI Safet.name: Stanford University, Center for AI Safety

Harvard University, Berkman Klein Center.name: Harvard University, Berkman Klein Center for Internet and Society
Harvard University, Berkman Klein Center.description: The Berkman Klein Center's mission is to explore and understand cyberspace; to study its development, dynamics, norms, and standards; and to assess the need or lack thereof for laws and sanctions. As an interdisciplinary, University-wide center, it brings talented and thoughtful people from around the globe to tackle the biggest challenges presented by the Internet.

World Bank Group.name: World Bank Group
World Bank Group.description: With 189 member countries, staff from more than 170 countries, and offices in over 130 locations, the World Bank Group is the largest and most well-known development bank in the world. It's a global partnership of five institutions working for sustainable solutions that reduce poverty and build shared prosperity in developing countries. Its five organizations are the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, the International Development Association, the International Finance Corporation, the Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency, and the International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes.

University of California, Center for Hum.name: University of California, Center for Human-Compatible Artificial Intelligence
University of California, Center for Hum.description: The Center for Human-Compatible Artificial Intelligence is a multi-institution research group based at UC Berkeley with academic affiliates at a variety of other universities. CHAI's goal is to develop the conceptual and technical means to reorient the general thrust of artificial intelligence research towards beneficial systems. They aim to refocus AI away from the capability to achieve arbitrary objectives and towards the ability to generate provably beneficial behavior. Because the meaning of beneficial depends on properties of humans, this task inevitably includes elements from the social sciences in addition to AI.

Massachusetts Institute of Technology, M.name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Media Lab

George Washington University, School of.name: George Washington University, School of Media and Public Affairs

Machine Intelligence Research Institute.name: Machine Intelligence Research Institute
Machine Intelligence Research Institute.description: The Machine Intelligence Research Institute was one of the first groups to become concerned about the risks from artificial intelligence in the early 2000s.  It is a research nonprofit studying the mathematical underpinnings of intelligent behavior. The organisation's mission is to develop formal tools for the clean design and analysis of general-purpose AI systems, with the intent of making such systems safer and more reliable when they are developed. Their methodology is to break down the alignment problem into simpler and more precisely stated subproblems, develop basic mathematical theory for understanding these problems, and then make use of the newfound understanding in engineering applications. MIRI seeks to help jump-start a paradigm of AI research that is conscious of the field’s long-term impact.

Columbia University, Department of Micro.name: Columbia University, Department of Microbiology and Immunology

Harvard University, Faculty of Arts and.name: Harvard University, Faculty of Arts and Sciences

US Government, Federal Bureau of Investi.name: US Government, Federal Bureau of Investigation

Harvard University, T.H. Chan School of.name: Harvard University, T.H. Chan School of Public Health
